cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northeast through Saturday, then forecast to slow and turn westward toward the central Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Port O'Connor/Matagorda area

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Gulf coast from northern Mexico to Louisiana, including the entire Texas coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible late Sunday through Monday, with a 57% cumulative chance of 34-kt winds and an 18% chance of 50-kt winds at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 2–4 ft storm surge along the central Texas coast, including Matagorda Bay and Calhoun County shorelines.
weather_observation.rainfall: Prolonged heavy rain bands could bring 4–8 inches, locally higher, beginning late Sunday and continuing into Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, minor coastal flooding during high tides, and possible brief tornadoes in rain bands.
